result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM - case called.  Defendant Matthew Alan Berndt appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Defendant.  Court sets bond.  Court questions Defendant regarding scheduling the preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
